newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank higher on Yahoo! OTC registration news.
newsitem.headline: Softbank higher on Yahoo! OTC registration news.

text.p: Shares of Softbank Corp were sharply higher in Monday afternoon trade, buoyed by news that Yahoo! Japan Corp was preparing to register its shares for trade on the over-the-counter market, brokers said.
As of 0424 GMT the shares stood at 9,890 yen, up from the 9,400 yen close on Friday.
"Yahoo! Japan is planning to register for OTC trade because its business is doing well, which is also a plus for Softbank," a "Big Four" broker said.
Yahoo! Japan is a joint venture between Yahoo! Inc, a U.S.-based Internet search provider, and Softbank, a Japanese software publisher.
It started offering its service in Japan last April.
The company had initially intended to register its shares on the second section of the OTC market, set up to make it easier for start-up companies to raise funds.
But after enjoying steady business earnings, Yahoo! Japan is now seeking registration on the main OTC market, a company official said.
